fields.description:
The HashSet comparison is not working for some reason:
{noformat}
java.lang.AssertionError: expected: java.util.HashSet<[hb]> but was: java.util.HashSet<[hb]>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.api.resource.TestPlacementConstraintTransformations.testCardinalityConstraint(TestPlacementConstraintTransformations.java:116)
{noformat}
fields.summary: YARN precommit build failing in TestPlacementConstraintTransformations

comments.body: I ran into this as well and will put up a patch with a fix.

This message was automatically generated.

Hi [~shanekumpf@gmail.com]
{quote}In {{PlacementConstraintTransformations}} I see null is explicitly set on the returned constraint. Should this be SELF?
{quote}
You are right. We should not pass null any more to a target expression. Instead of fixing the UT code, I think we should fix what you pointed out in {{PlacementConstraintTransformations}}, by replacing {{null}} with {{AllocationTagNamespaceType.SELF.toString()}}, which is the default namespace in string form for allocation tags.

Hope it makes sense, thanks.
Thanks, [~cheersyang] - makes sense. I've attached a patch with that fix.
